alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Iron; Kane; Piute; Sevier (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 19 at 11:09AM MDT until further notice by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Utah... Sevier River Near Hatch affecting Garfield, Sevier, Kane, Piute and Iron Counties. .Warm temperatures and snowmelt will continue to result in increased river flows. For the Sevier River...including Hatch...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding will continue through at least May 26th. Thereafter flows are expected to fall back into a minor flood stage. * WHERE...Sevier River Near Hatch. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 3.9 feet, minor flooding will affect fields. Assorted bridges and select low lying structures will receive minor flood damage. At 4.3 feet, moderate flooding will affect fields, roads and bridges along low lying stretches of the Sevier River including the river crossing along the South Hatch Dam Road. Additionally, structures in low lying areas will receive flood damage including seasonal homes near Bullberry Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM MDT Friday the stage was 4.4 feet. - The river stage is currently near peak for spring runoff at 4.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate remain above moderate flood stage through the next 7 days with a maximum value of 4.5 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 3.9 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM MDT.
